articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Wednesday after data pointed to a cooling labor market, while a pullback in U.S. Treasury yields from their multi-year highs also supported investor sentiment.
articles.title: Wall St rises at open after fresh jobs data, Treasury yields retreat

articles.author: Joseph White
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) on Wednesday secured a new $6 billion line of credit and estimated that the cost of the United Auto Workers strike was $200 million during the third quarter, a company spokesman said.
articles.title: GM locks in $6 billion credit line as strike costs rise

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A Black former factory worker for Tesla lost his bid on Wednesday for a third trial in his race discrimination lawsuit against the electric carmaker, after a California federal judge rejected his claims that the company's lawyers had engaged in misconduct and tainted his trial.
articles.title: Ex-Tesla factory worker loses bid for new trial in race bias case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook made $41.5 million after taxes in his biggest share sale in two years, a U.S. securities filing showed.
articles.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook makes $41 mln from biggest stock sale in two years

articles.author: Lananh Nguyen, Tatiana Bautzer, Saeed Azhar
articles.description: Citigroup (C.N) has embarked on its biggest reorganization in decades, its managers are reviewing staff rosters to determine by November who will stay in place, be reassigned or laid off, according to a global memo to staff on Wednesday seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Citigroup outlines layoff process, reassignments in overhaul -memo

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried's trial on charges of stealing billions of dollars from customers of his now-bankrupt FTX cryptocurrency exchange is set to resume on Wednesday, with the judge aiming to finish selecting a jury and move on to opening statements.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's trial to resume with jury selection, opening statements

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Toyota Motor (7203.T) and LG Energy Solution (373220.KS) signed a supply agreement for lithium-ion battery modules for use in the Japanese automaker's battery electric vehicles that will be assembled in the U.S., the companies said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Toyota and LG Energy sign battery supply agreement to power EVs

articles.author: Richard Cowan, David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives was leaderless on Wednesday, after hardline Republicans narrowly won a vote to oust Speaker Kevin McCarthy, an historic move that triggered what will be a lengthy and likely messy battle to find a replacement.
articles.title: US House adrift as Republicans fight over their next leader

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Two families, one enslaved by the other. In many ways, their journeys since emancipation illustrate a broader truth about U.S. history: the legacy of slavery.
articles.title: American Dreams

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden announced on Wednesday that his administration has approved an additional $9 billion in student debt relief for 125,000 borrowers.
articles.title: Biden announces $9 billion more in student debt relief
